name: Fontainebleau Miami Beach

reviews.text: I was in Miami for business and have traveled all over the country attending conferences and visiting vendors. I would have to say that my experience at the Fontainebleau was the best yet. My room was situated on the 19th floor and provided me all the comforts of home. I had a kitchen, dining room, living room, Apple computer, and a tucked away semi-private bedroom. My balcony gave way to an amazing panoramic view from the Atlantic, to South Beach, and across to downtown Miami.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Experience

reviews.text: The pool area was exceptional. I had several pools to choose from and was able to find a comfortable spot almost immediately. Swimming in the warm blue waters of the Atlantic was my favorite part, and the staff tending to the guest there were very pleasant and accommodating.
reviews.title: Don't listen to the haters

reviews.text: The Fontainebleau has several exquisite restaurants on the property; each boasting a variety of delicious delectables. I spent several hours each evening just relaxing in the lounge in the main lobby.
reviews.title: How do you spell awful?

reviews.text: The only negative feedback I can add is that the service attendants at the pool were a bit slow in coming around for drink orders, and the resort parking charge was a bit steep at $34/night . Other than that, my overall resort experience was an A++. I would definitely recommend the Fontainebleau for business or family pleasure. You won’t be sorry.
reviews.title: Fantastic Facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never write and feel the need to after most of you on here had me paranoid I had made a mistake in booking. I literally just got back to NYC and I'm reviewing already.
reviews.title: So impressed with the service and staff at the hotel - they made our stay the best it could be!

reviews.text: I expect the Fontainebleau to have majorly expensive food, and extras. This is expected and common in nearly self-sustaining mega resorts. Remember, this hotel is practically a small city. It is HUGE and very beautiful. Very sleek and modern, with touches of art deco.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE SERVICE! It ruins the place.

reviews.text: The biggest problem, and the reason I don't ever want to return is the SERVICE. WOW. IT IS HORRIBLE. I think the hotel is not properly managed, or possibly understaffed. Examples of bad service: We called at 8pm for extra blankets. We got those blankets at 2:00 AM!!!! It took nearly 7 hours to bring some BLANKETS??? The next day we asked for a toothbrush and shower cap. It took them 4 hours to bring this.
reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations

reviews.text: ARE YOU KIDDING ME???
reviews.title: Everyone should experience this!

reviews.text: The one thing I got MAJORLY angry with was when we were by the pool area. We needed towels, and it was windy, so we were chilled from the pool water. I went to a one of the cabanas which housed tons of freshly rolled towels. It took me about 5 minutes to find someone. Once I asked them for a towel. They said "We ran out of towels".
reviews.title: luxurious and pampering experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: EXCUSE ME???? I then proceeded to point at the cabana FILLED WITH ROLLED UP TOWELS. The lady then mumbled something about not being able to access those towels. WOW. From that point on, I VOWED TO NEVER COME BACK.
reviews.title: OVER THE TOP

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying in a tower suite on the 35th floor. The suite was beautiful with two bathrooms (one with Jacuzzi tub, bidet, full vanity etc), two balconies, sitting room and dining together, full kitchen with wet bar, microwave, stove, dishwasher, washer and dryer. The bay view from my room was beautiful!
reviews.title: Great Tower Room
Not so hot
reviews.text: I only ate at a the informal retaurant by the beach. There is a lot of construction so if you have an ocean view, you are going to see this as well.

I had only one problem. I was attending a confrence and my group prepaid for our rooms through thier agents Ambassadors from since February. Apparantly, the hotel never received the payment from Ambassadors. Despite the fact that I had proof of payment, one Front desk agent, Nashali was insistent that I pay for the room again and insisted that I sort it out!! She totally tuned out everything I said to her and demanded that I pay again! Of course I did not. By the time I was ready to leave it still was not sorted out. The young lady who checked me out understood though and removed the room charges from my bill.
reviews.title: Not Great, Not Horrible
FontainePUE....
reviews.text: The experience there was not a wow! but my suite certainly was.

reviews.title: Do Not Ever Stay Here
reviews.text: Walking into the Resort, by all appearances, it is gorgeous. The lobby is huge and ornate, the view is amazing, the pool and beach are enticing and relaxing. However, when we got to our room in the Versaille Tower, we were brought to a sad reality. Usually I think of a hotel room as a place to rest your head at night and it doesn't have to be luxurious, but our room was pretty nasty.

I'd like to provide some feedback about my recent stay at the Fontainebleau . My trip started well, as I was pleasantly and efficiently received by the valet in the busy driveway of the main entrance. The valet was helpful and welcoming. I then proceeded to the conveneint temporary registration desk set up by the drive. I was warmly greeted by Athina, who proceeded to check me in. Unbeknownst to me, my credit card was past its' expiration date, causing me to embarrassingly fumble for my other card, before recalling that I had left it in the car. As I worked through the situation, Athina was incredibly gracious and friendly, and then quickly engaged the valet and bellman to assist while my car was retrieved and my credit card obtained.
reviews.title: Hip Without the Hassle... - Business and Pleasure A++

reviews.text: After checking in, I encountered the only negative point of my experience, the campus is extremely large, with 4 hotel buildings. It was difficult to find the Versailles tower where I was staying, and signage was poor or non-existent. However, when I took the elevator up to the 14th floor of the incorrect tower, the housekeeping staff was very helpful and gave me clear directions to the proper building.
reviews.title: The Spa

reviews.text: I was at the hotel to speak at an event being held by my employer. We had reserved a conference room, serving dinner and staffing open bars in the reception area as well as the dining room. Every staff member involved in the process was exceptionally competent, courteous and professional. From setting up A/V, to the wait staff and bartenders, they were exceptional. In addition, the meal which was served simultaneously for 200 people was delicious (a rare feat)! We hold many of these events, and this was the best overall experience we have ever had while hosting an event.
reviews.title: Great location, great view and great restaurants!

reviews.text: The huge property is immaculately clean and well maintained, and there is something for everyone. I'm sure we didn't even take advantage of most of the amenities. Every staff member, including; the hostess at the poolside grill, wait staff throughout, the bartender at the Lobby bar, the front desk staff, the valets and bellmen, were incredibly warm, competent, and helpful. It was really impressive to see such a large property managed so exceptionally well.
reviews.title: A definite hotspot in Miami Beach!

reviews.text: Of course you get the great energy and hip vibe you expect in SOBE, but without the hassles of noisy rooms or indifferent service. I would highly recommend the Fontainebleau for both leisure and business.
reviews.title: Terrible service

reviews.text: The Fontainebleau Hotel Miami Beach is a beautiful hotel through and through. The pools are immaculate and boast lovely landscaping, the lobby bar has a lit-from-below blue floor--even the conference facilities are nicely lit and modern. Not at all stuffy. I was greeted warmly by the front desk staff, the bellmen and every maid or worker I passed. Only at the pool did I have to flag down help in order to get a lunch menu.
reviews.title: A true luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like at many luxury hotels, the restaurants and drinks are expensive and there isn't much to walk to outside of the enormous hotel complex. But right outside the front door you can catch the L bus to South Beach and the famous Lincoln shopping area.
reviews.title: Everything was amazing, besides the pretentious service...

reviews.text: My room (I was upgraded) featured an enormous ocean view balcony, a king-sized bed, flat screen TV and 20 inch iMac with internet. My understanding is that the resort fee covers wireless, pool towels and gym access.
reviews.title: Extreme in Every Way

reviews.text: We chose Fontainebleau to stay the weekend of March 26, which is an extremely insane weekend in Miami due to the WMC, Ultra, and the tail end of Spring Break hoping that it would be set back from the massive crowds that weekend... and we were right. Upon arrival the bellboys were instantly attentive, took out our luggage, and pointed us in the direction of the reception desk (without looking for a tip even though we tip everyone). The employee at the reception desk (I wish I could remember his name) was absolutely outstanding, gave us all of the information that we needed and sent us on our way. We were more than pleased with our room (at 679 a night).. it was immaculate and we had an incredible view of both the beach and downtown Miami from our balcony in the Versailles tower. We did encounter a slight misunderstanding with the "20 second rule" for the mini-fridge. I had taken out more than a few bottles of random juices and alcoholic beverages to put some of our stuff in, not realizing that you could actually just rent one for your room (which we would have done), and was not even going to ask for the charge to be taken off... but asked instead if we could bring the alcohol down to the beach instead of ordering drinks. They told us that it was not a problem, they would take it off of our bill as long as the bottles were not open. (This was KEY Fontainebleau staff... instead of making us fiddle with open bottles on the beach, we spent over 300 on alcohol and food that day on the beach just the 2 of us, and it was amazing, so thank you.... you actually made out better this way :))
reviews.title: Very Nice but Expensive

reviews.text: The only problem that we encountered was the attitude of your staff at the pool and beach. We sat to have lunch at La Cote, and our waitress seemed strung out, and barely even acknowledged that we were sitting at her table, and it took us 2 hours to eat lunch.. and we STILL double tipped her. Same day, spent almost the same amount of time at the bar trying to get drinks, and were again met with horrible attitude.
reviews.title: Simply amazing place.

reviews.text: A convention hotel that longs to grow up and be a REAL South Beach hotel...But, it wont happen. Overscaled development, poor planning, a maze of corridors and outdoor spaces. BAD Service. Understocked mini-bars and toiletry kits!!!! Too Cool for School attitute or total ineptness. Where do I begin.
reviews.title: All Bad All the Time....Totally Miss the Market

reviews.text: The rooms are half the size they advertise.
reviews.title: I would Never Stay Here Again.

reviews.text: Services are nickle and dime....$15 to work out. $10 for beach chair. $15 for umbrella. $200 for cabana. No water or glasses in the rooms!!!! $650/night for WHAT????
reviews.title: Appalling service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is too expensive, lack quality and service is attrocious.
reviews.title: Did not stay, just checked the hotel out.
Do yourself a favor -- Don't stay here!
reviews.text: BAD COFFEE too!!!

If you have children this place had the best pool we had ever seen. They have 3 hot tubs, an enourmous pool with waterfalls, a huge kids pool, large water slide, and lazy river. We stayed in the new section of the Fontainebleau tower and we were very impressed with the room. Everything is new and clean, it had a flat screen tv, large bathroom with serparate shower, nice balconey that overlooked the bay. I would have given the resort the highest rating but the parking fee of $23 a day was outrageous and getting your car was slow.
reviews.title: Loved the New Section of the Fontainebleau

reviews.text: Returned this evening from a five night stay at the Fontainebleau "resort". I did not have the privledge of staying in the new tower, but was placed in the older, main building. These rooms were average at best, certainly not worthy of the price paid. When I entered the room, the bed was made, but I noticed that it had not been turned over from the previous guests. The sheets had make-up/hair on them, and the coffee cups had lipstick marks. I notified housekeeping of this fact and was assured that they would be right there. Upon returning 6 hours later at midnight, I found nothing had been done and at this late hour, and decided to sleep on a beach towel I brought with me... needless to say it was anything but a restful night. When I notified the front desk the next morning there was not an apology, but only an offer to remove the $23 parking fee for the day. I had one employee offer a smile during the stay, while the remaining workers seemed put out by taking an order, ringing up a purchase in the gift shop, or answering a question. Food from room service was cold when I got it, and it took 15-30 minutes to have my car brought around when there were 3-4 people at most waiting for their vehicles. The Fontainebleau bills itself as a resort, but in previous stays at other resorts, customer sastifaction was attempted at every turn... not so in Miami. The tower rooms were very nice (a travelling partner stayed in these rooms), but the overall experience was horrific. I understand they are planning to update the two older parts of the hotel soon, which might make the rooms worthy of resort status... however, if you do go, just make sure you insist on a tower room and don't have lofty expectations about customer service.
reviews.title: Horrific Experience

reviews.text: Stayed there for 3 nights last weekend and stayed in the "old" part of the hotel. For the quality of room, I'm not sure I would pay $50/night let alone $250. Service at the front desk was terrible as they seemed very irritated at seemingly simple requests. Keep in mind, the service is the same regardless of what tower you are in.
reviews.title: Bad service too...
Need's Improvement
reviews.text: I am a resident of Miami and I'm a little disappointed in what tourists think of our hotels after I stayed at one our popular hotels. I booked a 2 bedroom suite and instead we were given a 1 bedroom suite. Trying to make the best of the situation, we accepted the room. Everything was great at the hotel. I room in the PH had a beautiful view and the pool area was great. The food was terrible and expensive. The pool attendants were rude and looked miserable, espesially in the Cookies World where its the most important to be cheerful. Besides that, the overall experience was ok and if some changes were to be made, I would go back.

reviews.title: Great stay in the Fontainebleau Tower
reviews.text: The new tower at the Fontainebleau is great- beautiful new rooms, great lobby and breezeway to thepool and everything! The tower also has a nice seventh floor pool as well. The service is just never great when we go to the Fontainebleau- they just are not extremely accomodating and helpful, especially for guests paying over $400 per night! WE could not get a late check out, so I had to pay $50 for this disgusting parlor suite in the Versailles tower which is the dumpy tower that smells and has rooms from the 50s for a day so my family and I could shower and change and hang out for a little while.I thought it was inconsiderate (especially since it was my 4th year at this resort). I would stay in the tower again though. The main Fontainebleau resort is closing, and with their Versailles tower they kinda have to. Because the main resort is closing, I will not e going back next year- my family and I are gonna try the Loews South Beach Resort down the Street.
I am a Hotelista..........the room is it for me. So let me give you the pros and con about the Fontainebleau Resort. I stayed there with 3 friends from 10/16-10/19
reviews.title: MY Birthday Bash in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Will be great -- once it's finished!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: on collins avenue, approx 20 min from airport
reviews.title: Will be beautiful--once it's finished
Treated like royalty
reviews.text: Across from Star Island on the Bay.
Room: Excellent!!! We were upgraded to 1bedroom ocean view
reviews.title: Soon to be a FIVE STAR resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the hotel looks quite luxurious, the services and size just do not lend to a relaxing, upscale vacation.The hotel is more like a huge convention hotel. It took over 15 minutes and two elevators to get from the room to the pool area.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but never again, not relaxing.
Won't be back
reviews.text: Forget getting coffee in the morning, 20 minute line to buy a $4.00 cup of coffee.
Chairs by the pool were not free, and usually all full by 9 am. The beach was much better.
reviews.title: Beautiful Spot!

reviews.text: The food was mediocre and expensive.
reviews.title: Great but rough first night...
Great vacation venue, but too "hip" for conferences
reviews.text: The wait to get your car from mandatory Valet service was 45 minutes . While we always called in advance for our car, it was never ready.

I read a lot of bad reviews before I checked into this hotel for a convention I was attending the first week of December 2008. I was concerned by what I'd read so, I think it's important I write this review as my experience was the POLAR OPPOSITE of what I have read on this site.
reviews.title: Viva le Fontainbleau!

likes.liked: — You could spend an entire weekend happily never leaving the hotel. It's that good.
likes.disliked: — The gym and spa were not open yet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked in early on a Wednesday and although I wanted a room in the Chateau, only a room in the Versailles was available. The room was standard size and comfort for a 4 star hotel. The bathroom was a bit small and so was the "king" sized bed. The in room Mac didn't connect to the internet despite a lengthy visit from the IT department. However, the view was good and the linens, bath items and towels were superior. I ordered room service and was served a delightful "pizza" tart in less than 30 minutes. Delivery and presentation were 5 star. In the morning I learned (sadly) that the new gym was not ready and I would have to walk across 4 public lobby spaces to use the one that was available. I'm too modest to do that all weekend, especially since I'm in regular gym clothes and the lobbies are so spectacular I found myself slinking through them like a fugitive.
reviews.title: mixed feelings, wouldnt stay there again

reviews.text: That morning I called down early to the front desk of the Chateau tower to request a room change. Keep in mind this was the 2nd week the hotel was open for business. It was packed to the gills with events and people so my prospects for success were NOT good.
reviews.title: Awful!!!

likes.liked: — The Hotel is gorgeous..but thats about it.

reviews.text: I had to write a review. I was so nervous to stay here after reading some bad reviews on tripadvisor. I stayed dec.24- 29th 2005. I booked a deluxe ocean view room and requested a renovated room. I was happy to find out I was upgraded to a suite in the new tower. The room was wonderful oversized marble bathroom with seperate jacuzzi tub. The bed was so comfortable one of the best i have stayed in. Large balcony with great ocean and pool views. The staff overall was very friendly. the pool area my kids loved. IF YOU don't have kids i would recommend staying in south beach, closer to the night life. only negative things i can say is they did run out of pool towels the first day we were there but it was like 4:00 pm. but nobody went out of there way to get us any either! Valet was slow at times and they brought us the wrong car once. one morning the women at the coffee bar was kind of cold, unfriendly. overall we had a great stay and would definitely go back! food and drinks by the pool were good. beach was nice although south beach was a little nicer.
reviews.title: Loved it
5-Stars for New Resort Tower (Condo Hotel)
reviews.text: Keep in mind when you read the reviews that there are 2 buildings at Fontainebleau. There is the original Fontainebleau Hotel (desperately in need of renovation) and the new 5-star Fontainebleau Resort tower which is a very high-end condo hotel that opened in early 2005. I've stayed in both towers, and granted, the "unrenovated" rooms in the hotel tower are terrible right now (renovation starting in 2006). The new resort tower, is truly fabulous and worth every penny!

Just got back from x-mas week with our 2 teens from the Fountainbleau and were happy because the weather was great although the hotel couldn't handle the crowd. The hotel condominiums in the tower were beautiful to stay in with a lovely ocean view, one bedroom and pull out in the living room big enough for the 4 of us, it included kitchen, 2 bathrooms, washer and dryer. The elevators however broke a few times and took forever to get anywhere if you were staying on a high floor until we all demanded they be fixed. I am sure all hotels are crowded around the pool x-mas week, but here if you were lucky enought to get a lounge chair you were on top of the person next to you. Most people did not use the beach as they charged $10 for chairs on the beach. Kids said at Cookies world the slide didn't move fast and you had to help yourself down, and the lazy river pool was not heated. Food options are limited at the hotel with a 15% service charge tacked on even if you get lunch yourself poolside. After spending $70 for breakfast for the 4 of us we started buying things to keep in our kitchen for breakfast. The hotel's main dining room was sub par so we took a cab @ $10 each way most nights to Lincoln Rd. which had wonderful restaurants. We never rented a car due to the $23 a night fee and cabbed it everywhere as nothing walking distance except for Eden Rock which is awful. Ate in Joes Stone Crabs one night which is very touristy and good for people watching, but get there early as lines can get fierce. It was @$350 for the 4 of us. The gym at the hotel needs updating and doesn't face anything. Looks like they are adding a spa. Bottom line is years ago this hotel was "the place" and now
reviews.title: Not prepared for crowds at x-mas
End of an era
reviews.text: with all the new construction and added rooms they cannot accomodate all the additional people.

They're tearing down much of this hotel in March to rebuild. The resort sits on a huge footprint of land on South Beach, and the finished product will be magnificent. Right now, this tired hotel is ready for the wrecking ball. Everything is dated. The staff is uninterested. For a resort, their are very few amenities. There is no spa. The pool has no drink service. The restaurants are poor. Come back in 2008 when the resort is completely rebuilt. They promise a pool area as large and inviting as Atlantis in Paradise Island. For now, go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Loved the Bleau

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fontainebleau from 1/1-1/4. From the minute we checked in to the minute we left, we were shown how a first-class hotel that truly cares about its guests operates. Sholom couldn't have been more accommodating and welcoming, and went above and beyond our expectations to find us a room that perfectly suited our needs. Our room had a spectacular view, an iMac to use during our stay, and the bathroom was large and spotless (to the delight of my wife). The family-sized whirlpool tub made bath time for the kids fun, and they loved the kids' center, where Max led them through two days of adventures. The concierge team helped us plan a fun outing one afternoon, and the poolside restaurant service was warm and attentive. So many upscale hotels are hiring wannabe models as servers, so all you get is a bunch of eye candy and aloof, spotty service. Almost very server we encountered was professional and attentive, with the one exception being our breakfast server at Vida one morning. The waiter did not seem to understand our order and kept forgetting things. That was the only inconsistency in a fantastic three-day stay, as the rest of our experience was stellar.
reviews.title: A swanky, upscale hotel with excellent service

reviews.text: We took advantage of both the beach and many pools. They have an adults-only pool area, cabañas for rent, and lots of chaise lounges at each pool. The children were delighted to have so many different pools to swim in, and we loved the warm-cool-cooler pool temperatures...and we mention the kids' waterslide? They definitely know how to make everyone happy!
reviews.title: Best pool area at Miami Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were assisted by Candace at check out, who was also very professional and helpful. We can't wait until our next trip to the Fontainebleau!
reviews.title: Very pleasant and great fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last time I stayed at the Fontainebleau was in 1986. I have to say that the hotel (fortunately) has changed since then,,,! We (family with 3 children) stayed here for 4 nights in December 2012, in a family suite in the Tresor Tower. A very large suite (with an Imac at disposal) with a similarly large separate bedroom, a fully functional kitchen, large bathroom and a nice balcony with a southbound view of the beach and Collins Avenue.
reviews.title: Overall good place with one or two glitches.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This giant hotel (1600 rooms) just has everything. From the largest (and best) pool area at Miami Beach (with several poolside bars) to great (but pricy) restaurants. Service is good everywhere from check in to the staff at the pools and the beach and to checkout.
reviews.title: Overall A Nice Stay With A Few Glitches

reviews.text: Stayed at the Fontainebleau for a meeting. The space was fantastic, but the service was the worst I have ever experienced. This wasn't just a one time problem, this was universal. 1 hour for a drink at the bar, 1 hour for drinks poolside, 1.5 hour wait for cold room service, 6 hour wait for luggage, poor meeting support, final bill completely wrong ($5000 bar tab billed to my room when I wasn't even checked in that day). Worst part, management poorly responsive. I understand they just opened, but if they don't fix this in the next few weeks, they will be out of business in a year.
reviews.title: Fontainebleau, worst hotel in miami

reviews.text: I attended a convention this past week. The place was simply not ready. The service was horrible--6-8 hours to get luggage from downstairs. This is not an exaggeration. Room service took upwards of 3 hours. Multiple packages were lost--the man I spoke to in the mail room told me they were not ready for 300 packages in one day. Conceirge was not helpful, and overworked. 1 hour to get lunch at pool, Iced Tea ariving after the meal. (But three people offered to turn down my towel, and two people--simultaneously, offered me a cool cloth!). The lobby bar similarly was understaffed, and overpriced, even for Miami Beach. The only saving grace was the food in the restuarant, which was top notch.
reviews.title: Dont stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this place at all, certainly not for business travel, until they deal with the service issues.
reviews.title: Almost There, Will Be Great

likes.liked: — Great Pool Scene, Lots of Eye Candy

reviews.text: Spent a weekend there, and enjoyed the new look of the place overall. Service was decent, but not perfect. The best service took place at the pool, where we rented an opium bed for the day, and were waited on hand and foot! The only negatives were that the pool could have been warmer, and we only found one jacuzzi which was packed.
reviews.title: Reopened to soon...

reviews.text: The front desk was polite, but - when we asked for a room change - it took over two hours for them to accomodate us. They need to have more service professionals there based on the size of the facility. There are 4 towers; my advice is to avoid the Versailles and stay in one of the other 3 towers.
reviews.title: Stay Away at all Costs
Very mixed
reviews.text: I lucked out in that I reached Jenny, the Manager on Duty for the Chateau when I called. She was so kind and attentive and told me that although they were scheduled to be full for the weekend she would keep an eye on cancellations and give me the first available room she could find. She even took down my preferences to be in an ocean front room with 2 doubles instead of the smaller King type room I was in. And if that wasn't enough, she said that she would have my room moved for me while I was out of the hotel at appointments as long as my bags were packed and ready to go.

When I returned from a long day of sales calls, I checked with the front desk and found that she had changed my rooms and had my things moved for me. My new room was SPECTACULAR! Overlooking the ritzy pool with a full view of the beach, it had two double beds and a much larger bathroom. I was thrilled. Jenny called to check on me and make sure I liked the room and later I found a tray of chocolate covered strawberries waiting for me on my bed when I returned from dinner. I received complete royal treatment.
reviews.title: Stunning in its general incompetence.

likes.liked: — The room was beautifully appointed, and maintains a great sense of its historic place in Miami Beach.
likes.disliked: — Overpriced, security breaches, terrible service (with a few notable exceptions).

reviews.text: Housekeeping was terrible. I checked into a room in which the bathroom was not cleaned at all. The "clean" bathrobes in the closet had visible hairs. It took three days before my room was vacuumed, even after expressing my concern over it on a daily basis. Turndown service took place on only one night of the five that I stayed.
reviews.title: Has Potential but Work is Needed
Not Yet Ready for Prime Time
reviews.text: The "Ask Morris" service -- a sort of "one-stop shopping" experience for whenever you have a request/problem -- was beyond ineffective. One of my requests was completely ignored, and a wake-up call was entered incorrectly in their computer system, causing me to lose 45 minutes one morning.

The resort opened only one week before my stay, which may account for why a good number of the staff I encountered seemed to be floundering on common tasks. I would recommend not going to this hotel until after May 2009. Hopefully, by then, they would've worked out many of the kinks, and can therefore be a destination hotel in Miami.
reviews.title: Fontainebleau = Misled & Treated Poorly
Disappointed before even getting there
reviews.text: I haven't even gotten there and I am already disappointed with their customer service. I noticed today that my reservation for next week had me staying one day longer than I needed. I called their 800 # to make the change and waited on hold for over 15 minutes. I then hung up and called their non-800 line and am currently on hold (10 minutes and counting) to speak with someone. I hope that this level of customer service is not what I can expect next week.

First of all the hotel is amazing, me and my wife have experinced this hotel for the first time, we had room at Sorento tower which we belive it was the best spot at the hotel, we had some difficulty finding our way back from the main lobby since its huge resort!! food experince was great, beach and pool service was great! housekeeping was not good in the begining since we had a room with some missing items, BUT Luckly we had a great housekeeping supervisour who took care of our problems the whole stay and kept on checking on us everyday to ensure that we are pleased and we had everything we asked for,which made our stay very happy, i think he was mediterranean name al faouri, he also had great conversation with him;))))) overall we think the hotel is great place to be...
reviews.title: VERY HAPPY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a relaxing time at Fountainebleau on the Beach and at Lapis Spa. The pool was noisey and pretentious but that would be expected when all the seating area around the pool cost big bucks. This was a great get away for me and my wife and only 10 bucks to get to the action on South Beach. We stayed 3 nites and had 3 great dinners and Scarpetta's was the best in overall value. The maid service, front desk and guys out front were very good. The best hours for us in Miami were at Lapis and Scarpetta. Nice gym too. I had read many reviews before selecting Fountainebleau and can say that everyone should be prepared for the "sticker shock" and if this is a concern then just save your money for great dinners and hit the Subway around the corner for your other meals!
reviews.title: Nice Experience......
Poor service and overpriced
reviews.text: Poor service and overpriced food/drinks

Attended a conference at the hotel, and was looking forward to the stay with “perfect days” (from their website). I was going to share a room with a colleague and we had made reservations for a room with two queen size beds. At check in they informed us that we had been upgraded to a suite, however, the suite had one king size bed and one pull out sofa bed (a sure sign of a luxury resort, or what?), but of course the sofa bed would be made. According to Definitions on the Web; “Hotel suite - denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms”, well no, it turned out to be one single room, uh, unless we classify the bathroom as a room. In preparation for the next day’s early conference start we were ready to go to bed by 10pm. Imagine our surprise when we pull out the bed, and there is nothing there, no pillow, no linens, no blanket. After a quick search of the room to make sure that all these items were not stuffed away somewhere we called down to the desk to ask them to send someone to make the bed. 90 minutes, three phone calls, and two visits from various staff later we finally had two beds ready for us. Never during this time did we get a “Oh, I’m so sorry, we will get this fixed for you ASAP”, instead we had to explain five times why we wanted bed linens and were every time met blank stares (figuratively over the phone and literally in person). One of our favorite moments was around 11pm when two girls from housekeeping were passively standing by the “naked” bed with puzzled looks on their face. Clearly, they had no idea what they were supposed to do. It took five minutes to get the message through, and then another 15 minutes for them to actually make the bed.
reviews.title: ITS OK, BUT NOT THE PLACE TO RELAX
horrible fontainebleau
reviews.text: I stayed with my family at the fontainebleau for the 7th time even if last year I told in this review that it was the last time ! this hotel is worth and worth no longer hilton and ....will close on March 11th!!!

reviews.title: Near emergency room visit!!!
reviews.text: for 2 years and a half, even if I only paid 876 dollars for 4 nights I found this unacceptable : rooms not done at 7 pm although lots of calls, no towels main time in the room, dirty on premices, no security guards at the swimming pool entry so a lot of people from other hotels came in the WONDERFUL (I must admit) SWIMMING POOL. I complained and was refund 50 dollars, please don't hesitate to e-mail me and above all give me some hotels names because I intend to have my birthday(50) in miami from 30th of december untill 4th of january with my husband, daughters, sister, brother in law and nephews thank you!

reviews.title: Needs serious help in cleaning this landmark hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here based on the pictures and a few positive reviews. However, when we checked in our first room had no running water and the bathroom had obviously not been clean in a very long time. They quickly moved us to a new room (running water), but still very dirty. We walked around the pool area which was littered with beer bottles and trash. People were also eating in the pool. We asked the front desk to have our room cleaned, and they said "we'll take care of it right now". We went to the bar to kill time (with our two sons) and after an hour went back to a still dirty room. After calling the front desk to complain and tell them NOT to come clean our room as our children needed to get to bed, a housekeeper showed up ten minutes later and walked in on my half dressed husband before he could get to the door to stop her. But worst of all: my son, who has very mild asthma which doesn't even require routine treatment/medication (we always take it along) needed three breathing treatments during the night and we nearly called an ambulance since he couldn't breathe. We checked out and checked into the Royal Palm. Great hotel! Son breathed absolutely fine the rest of the trip. This hotel is a dump, dump, dump. Please believe these negative reviews and AVOID this hotel!!!!
Once a landmark designed by Morris Lapidus of hotel fame and now is a tried reminant of past glory. The hotel lacks managment to keep it clean, orderly, and with the service the price dictates.
reviews.title: Good....for a convention only

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Fontainebleau for a week in January for a conference he was attending. As far as conference hotels, this was one of the better hotels we've gotten to stay at. But would I ever come here for vacation? Absolutley not.
reviews.title: A legend has died---or at least it's in need of some serious CPR!

reviews.text: We stayed for a week in an ocean front Jr. Suite on the 9th floor of the Sorrento Tower and could not have been more pleased with our room and view. We combined a business convention with extra nights for some relaxation and great food. Check-in at the Sorrento Tower lobby was easy, no lines, no waiting. Quiet atmosphere in this part of the hotel might not be as fun for the party types who want the action of the main building. This tower is away from the main pool, bars and nightclub. It does overlook the children's pool but I'd rather listen to kids than the loud music that was playing at the main pool. Plus the kid's pool had a fountain that was on during the day to drown out any noise.
reviews.title: Great stay in Sorrento Tower, wonderful ocean view

reviews.text: Room was fabulous. Comfortable king bed, seating area, kitchenette with mini fridge, microwave and dishes for our Scarpetta leftovers. Also our room did have a coffee maker but not sure if all do in this tower. Two closets on each side of the bed and good drawer space in the armoire and bedside tables. Desk pulled out to make a dining table and to make room for your own computer since the in-room iMac took up much of the desk space.
reviews.title: Tranquillity on South Beach - Fontainebleau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was great, cool marble and granite. Could see the ocean view from the big bathtub by leaving the slider panels open. Didn't like that the toilet room did not have a door.
reviews.title: Food, Wine and Sand

reviews.text: Scarpetta (try the signature spaghetti and polenta dishes) and Hakkasan were wonderful. Good pastries and coffee at Solo, get there early to avoid the line. Also liked Fresh, easy to pick up a pizza or sandwiches that we brought back to our room. We loved sitting out on our balcony, watching the boats and cruise ships and listening to the waves. Bleau Bar was nice at sunset before the crowds of trendy people show up.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

reviews.text: We didn't mind that the automatic tip of 18% was on all our bills, that made it easier not to have to figure out tips. We love that when we travel to Europe, wish more places in the U.S. would do it.
reviews.title: Glam is in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little concerned that the massive renovation a few years ago might have changed and diminished one of Miami's most well-known hotels. But rest assurred, the Fontainbleau is still the Queen. The rooms are everything that you would expect: clean, comfortable, well-appointed and nice sized (for South Beach). The staff is extremely friendly - maybe too friendly - I wish they would have said something to the kids (or parents of) that were riding their scooters in the Lobby. Really? I am amazed at the lack of parenting. So obviously it is a family friendly hotel. Do not let that scare you away if you are a couple, though, looking for a romatic getaway. They have an adults only pool.
reviews.title: Still the grand lady!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, so the pools is where the partys at, but hey your in the best location in Miami Beach. Sholom at the fromt desk is the man, make sure to request him when you check in. His customer service goes above and beyond anything youve experienced. Attn: Fontainbleu management if youre reading this, give Sholom a promotion! FYI>>> hes the equivalint of what the New York Yankees are in the baseball business to the hospitality biz.... LOVE the Fontainbleu! Cant wait for the next trip! Miami brings da heat baby!
reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome, hey how about another slice of Awesome

reviews.text: P.S..... Sholom thanks for escorting me to my room to get the key issue resolved. You da man!
reviews.title: Five Star Service at the Front Desk - Sholom Neisten

reviews.text: My colleague and I checked in early and received amazing service from Sholom Neisten at the front desk. We had to share a room to cut costs for our company so we were a bit particular about the type of room we were assigned. Sholom found us the exact room we were looking for, basically giving us an upgrade to an ocean view with a balcony, and even let us check in early. He really went above and beyond!!!!! My colleague and I are extremely pleased.
reviews.title: Exellcent Experience

reviews.text: I celebrated my birthday on January 5th at this beautiful hotel. I do live in Miami, but I wanted to spend it at the beach with friends. I never thought spending a few days at a hotel in Miami where I currently live, can make you feel like you're really on vacation. From the room, to the pool, and hotel staff were exceptional. Juliana Galardi and Anna Hoyos who helped me through this process to make it happen; were such great people to work with. I couldn't have asked for a better way to celebrate my birthday. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, (Even if you live in Miami and want to get-away for a few days).
reviews.title: My getaway

reviews.text: I just loved this hotel. For 17 bucks you got internet, gym, and beach facilities. I loved that my friends and I could all connect to the internet under that same deal. then we stayed for the mother's day special and got free breakfast and this little coupon pack with free things and discounts. The hotel is beautiful and clean. If you want to party, there is a great bar next to the pool with loud music, if you want to relax, you go to the beach.
reviews.title: Loved this place -- lots of great packages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only problem -- the food in the hotel was INSANE! 6 bucks for a bottle of water, 17 bucks for 7 wings and 5 bucks for a coffee. not great on that end but all in all, a great spot!
reviews.title: It's a fantasy world that you dream about

reviews.text: We came over from Dublin/Ireland on Honeymoon and from the word go we were treated like royalty... To start we got an upgrade to suite when we checked in then to follow in the Blue bar "Eddie" looked after us very well with a bottle of champers and great advice about what cocktails to have where to go and what we could do over here. Also the barmaid "Trish" was brilliant with advice on EVERYTHING in Miami. Suzanne the bar manager couldn't do enough for us in terms of food, drink, entertainment, booking our table in the restaurants and recommending the popular dishes and having the laugh with us etc. All bar staff in the Bleu Bar are stunning and so nice. Overall it has been a holiday of a live time. We would recommend anyone to try experience the Fontainebleau like we have, the food, pool, people, service are too die for. Its costly in ways but its worth every cent.
reviews.title: Best staff I've ever encountered

reviews.text: The front desk supervisor cynthia dill is a total sweetheart as all staff was. There are plenty of beautiful and convenient amenities and the view from our room is priceless. I am currently writing this on the unlimited free internet with the room. The clubs are also the hottest in Miami right now so great for no drinking and driving!! MUST MUST MUST Stay!!!!
reviews.title: Livin it up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very grand hotel, with an amazing buzz about the place, full of style & class. Beautifully designed, and such great restaurants.
reviews.title: Yo Should stay here

reviews.text: Loved the energy at this hotel. I arrived early afternoon on a Thursday and the lobby and lobby bar was filled with people talking, laughing and drinking. Had a "party like" atmosphere. Granted there was a huge convention there so many of the people were there for a convention. But the staff was very helpful, check in was a breeze, rooms were clean, small bathroom but it is an old hotel. Beautiful lobby. Scarpetta was an awesome restaurant, Vida was good for lunch and breakfast. Those were the only two I visited on property.
reviews.title: Terrific Miami Hotel

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that the waiters are not the best at filling water glasses, tea or coffee, but they were amazing at trying to fill my wine glass. This happened at 2 of the restaurants and meals I ate in private meeting rooms with my company.
reviews.title: Large-scale luxury

reviews.text: Amazing pool, beach area and the Gym was awesome. I had an intense and exceptional personal triaining session in their gym with Shawn Credle, I highly recommend him as he is an amazing trainer.
reviews.title: Love boat on steroids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many things to do at this resort/hotel. Next time I'd go to only relax and enjoy the entire property.
reviews.title: FontaineBleau Miami.

reviews.text: I'm not typically attracted to large cruise-ship like resorts, but Fontainebleu was terrific for a one-night business trip. A friendly server was on-hand to address one's every need, and my room was clean, spacious and came with a few bonuses like a private balcony and ocean view. The food and drink is expectedly overpriced, and it takes 10 minutes to traverse the winding corridors from restaurant to pool to rooms, but if you're okay with that, this is a great spot to relax.
reviews.title: What an incredible hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at Fontainebleau for a mini vacation while my husband attended a conference. We received excellent service when we checked in and were upgraded to a Junior Suite in the Sorrento building. The room was very spacious, clean and had great amenities. Loved the Mac and the television in the bathroom! The beach and pools are beautiful! I had no problem getting a beach chair or one by the pool, but we were there during the week and it was fairly quiet. I loved the pool on the 5th floor of the Sorrento building. It was very quiet and had a fantastic ocean view! I felt like it was my own private pool at times, very nice! My husband and I had lunch at La Cote and the service was great and the food was very good! It is pricey, but it is in Miami beach. Overall worth every penny we spent! Loved it!
reviews.title: Great staff! Great hotel!

reviews.text: Checked in along with about 8 others and the first thing was our rooms had been cleaned but the rooms were not clean. Lipstick on the glasses along with finger prints, food crums on the desk, floor hadn't been vacuumed, long black hair on the shower walls and around the sink. After complaining to guest services they sent a maid to vacuum, but not to clean the room. I had to complain again before they sent a 2nd person to really clean. After rejoining the other guests, stories stated being exchanged about how bad their rooms were. One person's room (bathroom) was so discusting she demaned to me moved to another room.
reviews.title: Beyone Awful

reviews.text: Later the first night several people ordered room service, took over two hours to arrive.
reviews.title: Never going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel bar staff - don't be in a hurry for a drink. Vida restaurant , staff doesn't listen. Continuity either left items off orders or brought wrong items. Dinner at the Gotham Steakhouse was very good. Nice caring staff, and everyone enjoyed their meals.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

reviews.text: After having a little chat with our two poolside waiters about customer service and taking care of guests, they got the message and really steped-up their service. We did have a nice afternoon around the pool with our group of about 15 people. Our two guys did get a nice fat tip.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!
New Hotel needs alot of help.
reviews.text: A massive hotel/renovation with problems and an attitude problem. The right hand just doesn't seem to know what the left hand is doing. We booked this hotel months before they even opened and called them twice to confirm our reservation and breakfast package. We were put in a horrible room..BE SURE NOT TO GET THE 4th FLOOR. You will overlook the rooftop with every piece of machinery to make this hotel run. Of course they didn't have our original reservation on file. While they finally gave us a new room (after over an hour of sitting around) they just kept missing the mark. GREAT HOTEL FOR PAY TO PLAY POOL POLITICS!! We have traveled to the finest resorts in the world and have never seen a culture like this anywhere. The more you tip the more likely you are to get the lounge chair of your choice. The pool attendants are given territories around the pool therefore they each start making their own rules for saving chairs and therefore increasing their tips. The pool manager actually said to us, "you have to understand, this is a tipping culture". I wouldn't have believed it if I didn't hear it with my own ears. They will give your chairs away to the next guy who tips them higher than you did. You know that poor management trickles down from the top and this hotel certainly follows this theory. During a sold out Christmas week, I was actually told that lounge chairs were being reserved for the hotel manager and his family. By the way, don't forget your high heels for the pool, the last time I saw as many women in high heels and bathing suits was during

reviews.title: I Wouldn't Go Back If You Paid Me!
reviews.text: the Miss America pageant! 'This hotel is no great shake, the rooms are very small, not at all good for a family with one or two kids in the same room. No place to even put your suitcase down. By the way, the cost to use the gym is $50.00 for hotel guests....how arrogant is that?

reviews.title: Greeeeeat!!!!!
reviews.text: I have probably only posted a review on Tripadvisor once and I have traveled all over the world but I felt it was the only thing I could do to save others from checking in to this HORRIBLE hotel.

reviews.title: The most appalling service I have ever experienced at any hotel
reviews.text: We knew service would be bad because the hotel is big and it was Christmas week but in our wildest dreams, we never expected it to be this bad.

reviews.title: awful
reviews.text: We booked a two bedroom suite and we arrived on Christmas. We were checked in pretty fast but there was no "welcome" or "how was your flight?" - barely even a smile. We waited a long time for our luggage to come up in to the room. The two bedroom suite which was about $1300/night was newish, but for such a "sceny" new South Beach hotel, the room could have used a decorating update! We had a kitchen in our room and were not provided with any basic amenities like dish soap. The set up was good because we had our young daughter, but it was nothing special. Here are just a few things we experienced on our trip:

aka: Fontainebleau Miami Beach Hotel Miami Beach
description: A spectacular blend of Golden Era glamour and modern luxury, Fontainebleau today reinvents the original vision of legendary architect Morris Lapidus – a stage where everyone plays their unique part. At Fontainebleau, striking design, contemporary art, music, fashion and technology merge into a vibrant new kind of guest experience. We invite you to enter a world where you are free to play, shop, dine, spa, meet or simply relax – however you define your perfect day. Express yourself in an environment that surrounds you with every kind of pleasure and invites every sort of adventure. Following a $1 billion renovation, the 22-acre oceanfront hotel features signature restaurants by award-winning chefs; two chic nightlife venues; a two-story, 40,000-square-foot spa, expansive poolscape, a pristine Atlantic Ocean beach and state-of-the-art conference and event facilities. A landmark since its debut in 1954, Fontainebleau has been restored and transformed by a team of renowned architects and designers to create the most dynamic destination resort on the eastern seaboard.
